website_summaries.verdict: A good, basic machine with decent cooking space and a terrific price.
pros: Has the advantage of a removable drip tray, making cleanup easier in spite of its larger cooking area
cons: Rare reports of uneven heat distribution

website_summaries.verdict: At 22 inches, this griddle has enough cooking surface to feed the whole family. Handles come off for easy cleanup.
pros: Slide-out drip tray removes and cleans easily
With handles removed, base stores in most standard 18-inch kitchen cabinets
cons: Griddle is not angled sharply enough for the drip tray to collect much grease when cooking fattier foods

customer_reviews.title: Beware! This was not new and had a broken piece!
customer_reviews.text: We used the griddle. It was fine. Upon cleaning the drip pan we noticed it had an edge broken When we looked at the manual we found writing from Nov 2017 from a previous owner. We got it Jan 2018. Not cool Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Saw other posts about warping, so initially set it ...
customer_reviews.text: Saw other posts about warping, so initially set it at lowest heat and gave it a couple of minutes. After surface temp stabilized on low setting, moved it to 350, then up to 500. No warping at all. Made pancakes with no oil and had absolutely no sticking. Very even cooking.
customer_reviews.author: hobiephil

customer_reviews.title: Not for pancakes!
customer_reviews.text: This griddle was a failure for pancakes. See the photo of the racing stripes this created when cooking. Preheated, correct temp, etc. Returned. Anyone know a good even heat griddle?
customer_reviews.author: Gary H

customer_reviews.title: Used once with no problem. Second time, it didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back in the beginning of August 2017, but I didn't get around to using it until December 2017. I used it one time to cook some pork belly and it worked fine. Tried to use it again for the second time in January and it won't doesn't turn on/light up/get warm at all. Hoping this particular unit just happens to be faulty. I would be willing to write a new review if I can return this nonworking unit in exchange for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Belser

customer_reviews.title: I have no idea if it was good or bad
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea if it was good or bad. I ordered it for my daughter's birthday and when it got her it looked as thought the package had been through a tornado. The griddle had a hole in it the size of a tennis ball. It took something to do that. I had to send it back and go to Walmart and get another one. It wasn't as large as yours, but at least it was usable. I don't think I will be ordering from Amazon in the near future. Not happy at all with this product or its delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy. Inconsistent heating and weird texture surface.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this electric griddle. I’m not happy for a few reasons. 1. After a few uses it does not cook evenly. I only use for pancakes. 2. The texture surface is weird. 3. The temperature is not consistent. I’ve only set it to 350 but it will become really hot, then not hot enough. I do like the removable handle/feet and it is easy to clean and store. I plan to replace it very soon.
customer_reviews.author: amazonjunkie

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this griddle for almost a year. I was never satisfied with it, and I should have just returned it after using it once or twice. My biggest complaint is the uneven heating. Pancakes and French Toast have lines (similar to another review) from uneven heat disbursement. Food overcooks along the heating element, and is undercooked everywhere else. Even bacon doesn’t cook evenly. I had a broil king previously and it was far superior and worth the cost. I am getting ready to purchase another Broil King griddle because I am done ruining food on this one. I definitely wouldn’t recommend and would never purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lousy heat control
customer_reviews.text: I waited several months to do this review because I wanted to give this griddle an honest workout. The temperature control and the heat distribution is the worst I've seen in my over 50 years of using griddles! when set at just over 300 the temperature on the grill measured with a laser thermometer will vary from 375 to over 400 degrees! It is almost impossible to cook on this griddle because the next time it is used set at the same setting on the control, the temperature will range between 275 and 400!! This is the first and last Presto grill/griddle I'll buy!
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: We purchased this a little over a year ago and ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this a little over a year ago and have used it about ten times. It has warped to the point that we can no longer make a round pancake. I wish I had purchased the warranty package that was offered.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Beth Swenson

customer_reviews.title: Great for Camping!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for a year now. It is perfect for camping or home. I like that the handles easily detach for storage, making it compact. It is thinner and lighter than the old one we had, and I was concerned that it would heat evenly. I does heat evenly, cooking pancakes, bacon, eggs, grilled cheese, all of it comes out cooked even. The surface has a slight texture, but nothing sticks, not even pancakes or eggs, both slide off easily. I wash it with very little soap, using mostly hot water to keep it clean. After a years use, it remains in like-new condition.
customer_reviews.author: Duane W

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This does a great job. As noted in other reviews, there are some spots that are hotter than others, but that's the nature of an electric grill. Not an issue. The non-stick surface is, as the name implies, non-stick. The removable handles/feet are a nice feature, well designed, and easy to use. The only issue I have is with the drip tray. It's could be larger. And it fits really loosely in it's mount. If you're not careful, the drip tray will pop out ... not a good thing when filled with hot drippings. Overall, very happy. Hope it spends a long, useful live cranking out grilled cheese and Reubens.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Preheat well
customer_reviews.text: I found the griddle to have uneven heating the first time I used it. A friend suggested I make sure it was preheated up to the temperature I needed. That was the key. Very pleased with the griddle and love the removable handles for storage.
customer_reviews.author: GoldenGirl

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed and Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I just finished my first use of this griddle, cooking pancakes. It worked great. I have a thermometer designed for reading temperatures on irons and other hot surfaces. With the griddle set at 400 degrees--the highest setting--the thermometer registered 425 degrees F in the upper left and lower right corners. In my opinion, that is within the desired margin of error and better that it be a bit high than too low. I like the fact that the handles attach and detach easily with springs instead of having to unscrew and screw them on. I'll update my review if I learn anything new.
customer_reviews.author: BSquared18

customer_reviews.title: This is very large and great for family meals
customer_reviews.text: I've been thinking about getting a griddle like this for a really long while and the main thing that gave me cold feet was the size of these things. I hesitated a lot because I couldn't know how exactly to store this in my apartment's kitchen. That's why I preferred this specific model because it's very thin. I had to sacrifice having a lid for it but I think it's been worth it so far. This is great for pancakes, that's for sure! I've tested it and it was so easy to make them with the griddle. I hope to make meatballs, eggs, french toasts as well.
customer_reviews.author: Omer

customer_reviews.title: Almost didn't buy this from the negative review
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new one as I cook eggs most every day and do pan cakes for the family every other week at least. This cooks very nicely and evenly, so I'm not sure why the reviewer said it does not, (main reason I'm writting this review). It takes longer to heat up than the indicator will show, so the first batch is normally a bit darker but they all come out the same which is great and it's a big skillet. I make about 6 pan cakes at a time with no problems when flipping. Would buy again, it's a good buy at a higher price and a fantastic buy at it's low price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff the aeroETop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought this griddle, I read a lot of reviews. As suggested, I always preheat it on low while I am making my pancakes and turn it to 355 when I am about ready to pour them. On mine, the end farthest from the control is a little cooler, but compared to my iron griddle this griddle is a party. I bought it because my hemp pancakes stuck so bad on my iron griddle. They come out great on this one. Yes, there is a small design in the texture but can you eat them? Yeeess! Two rounds of filling the griddle and your done! Actually that little raised design is a feature to help them not stick,
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Double check its temperature!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this as much as I'd thought I would, but its size and relatively even heating has made it helpful when griddling things like English muffins, as compared to a cast iron skillet. That said, don't rely on the temperature dial. I was making discarded sourdough starter crumpets the other day and set the dial to 300. I was wondering why it was taking a while to heat up, so I used my contactless infrared thermometer to check the surface temperature; it was over 400F! I turned the dial down to 250 and let it cool a bit. I then had to play back and forth with the dial to maintain it near 300.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R.

customer_reviews.title: This is the best griddle I've owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best griddle I've owned. It is my fourth in 24 years. I've not had any real issues with it. I do wish the cutout where the plug goes was rounded like the other three corners. That would provide a bit more room. This is a nice large griddle. Plenty of room for breakfast for a family of five in the morning. I didn't anticipate getting a non stick surface. I cooked an egg on it because it appeared to be non stick. I was very surprised at how well it did. It's been three months and I've not put oil on it while cooking to keep things from sticking.
customer_reviews.author: Skeeter-Bill

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't drain the grease from bacon. The small ...
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't drain the grease from bacon. The small plastic tabs broke of on one of the removable handles, so now the handle falls of because it doesn't stay locked on.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made.  Not the Quality Presto Used To Be.  Not Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my almost 10-year old Presto (smaller) griddle with this one, only to be sadly disappointed at the first use. It's a 22-inch griddle but you don't have 22 inches of cooktop because it doesn't heat evenly around the edges. At best it might work for about 16 inches. My pancakes have stripes which clearly shows where the griddle doesn't heat evenly. Returning this item because it doesn't cook evenly. Very disappointed ... I thought I was upgrading to a larger, improved griddle. NOT recommended. Thankful for Amazon's generous return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer T

customer_reviews.title: A griddle that is fantastic for breakfast!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these griddles I have ordered. I liked mine so much I got one for my in-laws. They love it too. Non-stick surface is great! Very easy to set up and use and then clean up. Spring clip easy remove handles are a great touch. Makes washing in the sink a snap. It is plenty large to get breakfast together for several people, but not too large to handle or find counter space for. I pull it out to make pancakes for the grand kids.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC griddle.  I wish I could give it more than 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to assemble (two removable handles that are simple to add and remove, a heating element/heat control that easily slides in and out, the main griddle and the grease trap.) That I put this together in under 5 minutes with a short glance at the instructions. Now, I can cook a whole breakfast with a single, easy to use skillet and cleanup is so easy. Just slide the heating element out and use a sponge and dish soap to wash the top of the skillet. And when they say non-stick, they really mean it. I haven't had to scrub this yet. I am so pleased with this product. It's really great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need cooking spray
customer_reviews.text: I have an induction stove top and have been searching for a simple griddle/pan to cook in bulk so I don’t have to find space for something larger but everything I’ve read reviews on seem unreliable. So after reading reviews I went with this electric griddle and I’m very happy with it. With its handles removed it’s slender enough for easier storage. Handles go on and off easily and it’s very easy to clean. I tested a small amount of egg and it isn’t a non stick surface. I used a bit of cooking spray and it fixed the problem when I was making French toast. Overall happy so far with the decision
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Gull

customer_reviews.title: Awesome griddle!
customer_reviews.text: I love this griddle. The textured surface doesn’t allow for sliding (butter, eggs, etc) and cooks evenly. The handles are so easy to take on and off and it cools down very quickly so you don’t have to wait a long time to be able to wash it. We actually bought one of these while we are on vacation and we left it in the cottage for others to use so when I got home, I checked to see if Amazon had it (why I questions I don’t know, of course they did) and I was happy to see it was cheaper than the one we bought at a store.
customer_reviews.author: DHL

customer_reviews.title: Love my Presto Griddle!!!!
customer_reviews.text: When my Presto griddle of 7 years needed to be replaced, there was no question of which brand to buy. I love my new Presto 07061 griddle. The griddle is to light weight you could carry it with one finger. The cook top is completely different from my old griddle. The cook top is large, textured, but as smooth as ice. I cooked pancakes first, the next day I fried eggs, and for lunch one day had grilled cheese sandwiches. It is so easy to clean. Nothing sticks to the surface and it was so easy to flip my pancakes. I totally recommend this griddle. I use mine every other day and am so happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: KittyCat5050

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pancakes
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement purchase for a different type of griddle. I have been extremely pleased with the performance of this griddle. Excellent heat distribution - I haven't noticed any "cool spots" where the food takes longer to prepare. Beautiful, perfect golden pancakes every time! Haven't used it for meats yet, but it works great for pancakes and grilled cheese sandwiches. Kind of a pain to take the handles off every time to clean it; not that it's difficult, just an extra step. Half the time I just wipe it clean with a damp cloth instead of undoing everything. It's easy enough to pop the handles off for a good cleaning - I'm just lazy.
customer_reviews.author: busy woman

customer_reviews.title: Warped, like everyone elses
customer_reviews.text: I like the griddle, but it warped like so many others. Update: I contacted Presto, and after some back and forth, they replaced my griddle. I had to show them it was warped, then provide evidence that I cut the cord on the controller before they'd send out a new one. That being said, they did send a new one. Wouldn't you know, the new one warped too! It is warped less, but is still warped. It is flat enough for most uses. The only thing that gives me fits are scrambled eggs. They want to immediately go center and into the drip pan.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Works well if you let it warm up.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to do Saturday morning breakfast. The one we received works well if you let it warm up first. I can only comment on the one we have, and it works very well for cooking eggs, bacon, pancakes, and sausage. We let it warm up for about 10 minutes before we use it, and have not noticed any 'hotspots' yet. Works for our purpose. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: D.W.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Get Hot Enough
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to cook a lot of pancakes. Simply stated, it doesn't get close to being hot enough for pancakes and it turns bacon into rubber. The pancakes eventually cooked but they had no color and were awful. I tried a second time, waiting until well after the temperature control light went out and got same bad results. Maybe this one was defective but didn't seem to be. The cooking surface seems nice enough and the overall quality is what I expected in this price range but if it can't cook, its basically useless. This one is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Don Honey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I love love LOVE the fact that this is fully submergable. My old griddle (a cheapie black Friday deal) got scrubbed so many doggone annoying times with baking soda trying to get the burnt blueberries off. Problem solved. Winner. This cooks 8-10 pancakes at a time which means I (the cook) get to sit down with my family and eat hot pancakes with them. The temperature distribution seems great, and it turns out beautiful fluffy French toast. So far I haven't managed to burn anything and everything has turned out delicious.
customer_reviews.author: stewartt

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill for quick pancakes!
customer_reviews.text: So far I have used my grill for pancakes 3 times and had no issues. I love the texture of my pancakes when using the grill compared to doing one at a time in a pan. The pan method must really dry out the pancakes cause using the grill really keeps them more moist and flexible! I don’t regret getting this! Saves me lots of time since I get them done so quickly! I can fit 6 medium sized pancakes on the grill. And no sooner you pour the batter down for the last pancake, the first ones are ready for flipping. Atleast that’s how it works for me.
customer_reviews.author: mbcakes

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have a large surface griddle that fits in my cupboard. Love the removable feet. Love the cool pattern on my pancakes and even brown, for the most part. Only issue is the packaging. When first griddle arrived, it appeared that a leg was broken, si I returned it. When I got replacement, I discovered that the broken piece was actually just added package protection, not part of the griddle. Ooops! So, overall, an excellent cooking surface that allowed me to easily cook 5 large blueberry pancakes.
customer_reviews.author: Jcr0306

customer_reviews.title: Great product, just really long.
customer_reviews.text: great griddle, just to large for me. should have gotten the smaller version. easy to clean and so much nicer than the last one I had, easy to plug in the power to the griddle (last one was a pain) heats evenly. Without the feet/handles it is as long as my cabinets (standard) are deep. You have to remove the feet/handles to store, so then you have all these parts all over the place. I simplify that by attaching them with the handles backwards under the griddle for storage and just flip the around for use.
customer_reviews.author: JKT

customer_reviews.title: Biggest best griddle for big family
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest, best working, easiest to clean skillet I've ever owned. I wanted to upload a picture to show it fitting 7 big sourdough slices (from Aldi) on it for French toast. For a family of 8, I love it. (I bought it because I had gotten it for my mom for Christmas and she liked it, and then my old griddle died and I needed a new one.) Taking it apart (the legs removed) is super easy and fast, and it fits in the cabinet better without the legs.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Bailey

customer_reviews.title: I love this griddle!
customer_reviews.text: I’m in love with this grill. It’s really large, so I can make my family pancakes on the weekends and we can all eat together! It’s amazingly non-stick. Like I “accidentally” got cheese on it to see what happened, and it just slid right off! In the first week, I used it for pancakes, quesadillas, turkey burgers, and grilled cheese. I found the guide for what temp to use very helpful and accurate. I agree with other reviews that it has hot spots, but I would say it’s to a lesser degree than other products of this type I’ve used. And I didn’t find that the beehive pattern left marks on any of our food.
customer_reviews.author: Attorney mommy

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Ignore the reviews about the "texture" on food.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what those other users are doing to get a strange texture on their food, but I've been using this griddle for months with no such results. It works great, regulates heat wonderfully, and distributes heat more evenly than any other electric griddle or skillet I've ever owned. It's easy to clean and store. Great product all around.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hulshizer, MS, MA

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can’t beat it. I beat this thing up and it takes the abuse. I use metal spatulas utensils, I have cut food directly on it and it still looks near perfect. (But who cares. For the price I can get a new one every year and beat it up all I want and not worry about it). It is also very large, plenty of space to cook for the whole family. Only slight complaint is some spots seem hotter then others but I cannot confirm. Nothing major though. Super easy to clean and non stick coating is very slick.
customer_reviews.author: David p

customer_reviews.title: Grease doesn't flow in to catcher very well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace another electric griddle that was past its prime. Was suprised at how much more splatter happens on this griddle vs the one it is replacing. I think the reason is because the griddle has not angled enough for the grease to slip in to the end that has the grease catcher. I've taken to propping up the back end just a bit to give gravity a hand and allow the grease to flow in to the catcher. An extra step I didn't have to take with my previous griddle.
customer_reviews.author: Bruin248

customer_reviews.title: Non stick surface flakes off after several uses
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product at first but within 60 days the non stick surface began flaking off and contaminating my food!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3’ power cord?!
customer_reviews.text: Just a 3’ power cord?! To save a few cents in manufacturing cost, morning breakfast for kids turns into search of garage for extension cord. Not sure how long the little wires on the removable handles will last. I’m guessing the handle springs will limit the useful life of the griddle. Other than that, first use went great! Thanks to Amazon for such great service and flexibility getting this item delivered after a few hiccups with deliveries.
customer_reviews.author: Samir

customer_reviews.title: Great value/be careful of the grease catch.
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill! Got it to replace my old presto grill and the newer one is better. I love the bigger size. The temp control works very well and the hear distribution is better than the older model I had. SO EASY to clean. I use this thing almost every day and it is as nonstick today as the day I bought it. Only complaints would be that the lip could be a little higher to make it easier to chase food with the spatula, and the grease tray can slide out VERY easily. You really have to be careful with that and absolutely not let kids or pets around when cooking something that drains grease in the pan.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cafardi

customer_reviews.title: Even heating and awesome nonstick surface
customer_reviews.text: I looked through a lot of reviews and a lot of sites before settling on this griddle. I primarily use it to make pancakes, which is a serious business in my family. Works like a dream! The surface heats more evenly than any other griddle I have used. The surface is kind of pebble texture, but it works amazingly well, the pancakes practically slide around on it and I have never had a problem trying to flip them. Clean up is very quick and easy as well.
customer_reviews.author: theFarmingDude

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful griddle!
customer_reviews.text: I was in search of a large, affordable griddle to cook breakfast on while camping with a large group of friends. The surface was plenty large enough to cook a bunch of pancakes and sausages. The thing I was most surprised about is how easy it is to clean! The legs pop off super easy so it fits in the sink and is easy to store in cramped spaces. Best purchase we've made in a long time! Rivals those $85 jumbo griddles at half the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Lane

customer_reviews.title: Mighty Meals
customer_reviews.text: This thing can do it all! We originally bought it for a date night during quarantine (we missed hibachi)... OMG talk about a good time... this thing can do it all... fried rice (check), onion volcano (check), eggs, chicken, shrimp (check check check!) We have made the classic pancakes and I will never make a pancake on the stove again. OH and grilled veggies - AMAZING, even gives it a nice char if you leave it on long enough. This griddle is so amazing - heats up quickly, easy to clean... highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: 6 Months In
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. Family of 5, use weekly at least. We were nervous about the handles being detachable and inevitably wearing out, but they are great and make cleaning a breeze. It is still incredibly nonstick, heat distribution is great. People seem to have bad reviews, not sure if they got a faulty product or just cook everything at 500 degrees? We have never had to use a scrubby on ours, wash it shortly after use and generally take care of it. Handles and drip tray fit great on the TOP rack of the dishwasher and make storing way more manageable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this handles break very easy
customer_reviews.text: Cheap handles. Broke already. No happy at all. Don’t buy this
customer_reviews.author: keagan t shaw

customer_reviews.title: We Love this griddle
customer_reviews.text: we had the older version that after years of weekly use gave up the ghost. (the handles broke off of the griddle and had to be babied to make work) I never knew what we had been missing until this one arrived. spacious. easy to clean, and a cooking space 30% larger than the old one. The handles EASLY remove for easier storage and both the griddle (minus the cord) and the handles are dishwasher safe!
customer_reviews.author: Rae of Hope

customer_reviews.title: Large, non-stick cooking surface
customer_reviews.text: We love this griddle! My kids would eat pancakes every day if I would let them. Our old griddle finally gave up on us, so we purchased this one. We love the large cooking surface. There have been no issues with food sticking, even when not using cooking spray. It is easy to clean, and though we have not had to remove the handles for cleaning yet, we do love the feature that allows for a deeper clean. The temperature is simple to control and has been evenly distributed with each use. We are very pleased with this griddle.
customer_reviews.author: CARMENDY11

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to the kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I love this electric skillet for pancakes, grilled sandwiches, even sautéing vegetables and chicken and cooking bacon, and more. The heat distribution is even and cleaning is a breeze. The size is so generous when making a batch of pancakes I don't have to do the pancakes in shifts like I do in the skillet. A bonus is writing out letters by using the baster with the batter, as there is plenty of room on the skillet!
customer_reviews.author: Anne L.

customer_reviews.title: Cooks relatively even, easy to clean, store
customer_reviews.text: Saw the posts about warping and took the advice of starting at a lower temp to slowly warm up before setting to the desired cooking temperature. No signs of any warping. Have owned for 2 months and cooked bacon, eggs, French toast, pancakes, grilled cheese sandwiches with great results. There are some spots hotter than others but you quickly recognize them and make adjustments. Very pleased with the grill and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J Diefendorf

customer_reviews.title: Reduce Pancake Prep Time Significantly!
customer_reviews.text: This had taken my Saturday pancake routine down significantly. And I can make bacon at the same time. You can literally make six good-sized pancakes at once. It is easy to clean and slim for storage. The only negative is that the pancakes come out a little ombre and the pattern on the griddle shows up on them. We don't care because it's so convenient to have breakfast done so much sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Nova

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: This one is slightly bigger than my last one which I like, but it does not cook evenly across the grill. A big chunk of the left side takes much longer than the rest of it, and the middle cooks slower than the edges (except the left side). When the time comes to get a new one, I will be looking at other brands, but it'll do otherwise. No point in spending more money.
customer_reviews.author: Pandora2288

customer_reviews.title: Great griddle for big family
customer_reviews.text: This is a great griddle for a family that has many family members. You can get more pancakes on it and it's a lot easier to clean than our old one. It is hard to store as it is longer so it's harder to find a place to put it but that's an easy trade off because we needed one that was bigger. It does help that the handles are easy to take off and put on.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Dodds

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Griddle
customer_reviews.text: Once in awhile, an appliance wins the user over completely. My wife loves this griddle, which means I love this griddle. Her favorite features: the texture, which distributes the heat evenly, and the easy process assembling and disassembling. It heats well, maintains the temperature well, and looks very nice. Her specialty: chocolate chip pancakes.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Detlie

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This griddle is fantastic, especially for the price. We eat a lot of pancakes at our house with 6 people living here, and that many pancakes takes a long time in a pan. I found the pancakes to cook evenly and with the non stick surface, I no longer use any butter or cooking spray at all. Super easy clean up and the legs can be removed with one hand!
customer_reviews.author: Susan D.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile!
customer_reviews.text: I'm finding a lot of uses for this griddle. Not only does it do what you'd expect, it does things I hadn't thought of to use a griddle for. Example: Ever come home from buying a to-go order burger and fries? You get home, the burger is cold, and fries are soggy? No problem. Just put them on the griddle and warm them up! I've used it to cook frozen fries, warm up cold plates on a cold day and so on. Obviously, you have to be careful. But I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wells

customer_reviews.title: I stole this grill
customer_reviews.text: This was a damaged listed for much less than the regular price and so I took a chance and Man did I hit the jackpot all the was wrong with it was the box had been damaged the grill works just fine it is the biggest and the best griddle that I have ever owned and I use it 3 to 5 times a week. Come on over for pancakes anytime you are in Michigan.
customer_reviews.author: James Morgan

customer_reviews.title: GREAT item; the box is the only thing. . .
customer_reviews.text: Skillets like this are not storage friendly so i like to keep the box and use it to store it in. Unfortunately, unless you take off the handles after each use - which is easy to do - it won't fit back in its box. Fortunately the handle design is really cool, easy to attach and unattach. It's just an inconvenience to have to do that. First world problems. The heat distribution, non-stick is wonderful. Pancakes are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Curt Northup

customer_reviews.title: I have a love hate thing going on here
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pan for somethings and how easy it is to clean, but i found the grease catch to be flimsy since it broke in about a week and the heat doesn't distribute easily. Once i figured out where the heat was going to be at it worked really well but overall I should have probably spent a bit more for a higher quality appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Grimrivet

customer_reviews.title: Great Griddle
customer_reviews.text: This griddle is great. It's non-stick, cleans easily, and cooks hot and pretty evenly. I use it mostly for pancakes and homemade veggie burgers and like it much better than my last griddle. I can easily cook 8 good sized burgers or 6 pancakes at a time on this, which I do often and then eat and freeze the leftovers. The only complaint I have is that it's bigger than my old griddle so it no longer fits in my cabinet or in the drawer under the stove. Now, I have to store it in the pantry. That's a pretty minor complaint since I have more cooking space.
customer_reviews.author: J. DobierTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Good value but has lots of hot and cold spots
customer_reviews.text: I've used this griddle off and on for about 2 years. It's a great value and makes it easy to make breakfast for a crowd. If you are looking to use a griddle occasionally, this one is a good choice. However, it doesn't have good heat distribution. You have to move the food around and the center cooks much quicker.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome electric griddle
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Easy to knock out pancakes bacon and eggs all at once. Good heat distribution, of course there are hot spots right on the heating element, but you can definitely cook on the whole surface. Handles pop off easily so you can clean. Haven't had anything stick at all yet. Great value for 35 bucks
customer_reviews.author: Garrison Householder

customer_reviews.title: Great heat distribution.
customer_reviews.text: Our old griddle died and we purchased this one to replace it. The heat is much more even from one end to the other than our old one. I checked with an infrared temperature meter. Also, the heat control and the legs are easily removable for easy cleaning. The nonstick surface works great so cleaning is simply wiping it off.
customer_reviews.author: R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, clean and store. An indispensable part of my kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this griddle for almost two years now, and it is still fantastic. Some things are just better cooked on a flattop, and this one is so easy to use. It cleans up well, too. Two years in, I don't have any of the surface issues I had with my old griddle. I also like that the legs are removable, since I keep it in its original box when I'm not using it. Whether cooking at home or at the campsite, I think everyone should own a griddle. And this one does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L

customer_reviews.title: Out of control!
customer_reviews.text: So today I wanted to grill some chicken breast and this thing started to over heat. I had set the temperature to about 325, but then it seem to get hotter because what grease I had on there started to explode violently. It scared the hell out of me. Even when I turned down the temperature to 225 it kept getting hotter.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and works great
customer_reviews.text: A must buy if you are looking for a griddle. Very easy to clean. Easy to break down and reassemble. Cooks great and takes up little space compared to what we use to own. Heat distribution, I would give about a 95% there is one very small dead spot plus a lower temp by the drain. Highly recommend on buying.
customer_reviews.author: ScottB

customer_reviews.title: Five Star Griddle!
customer_reviews.text: This griddle is exactly what I was looking for! Have used it twice to cook pancakes and am delighted with it's performance. Heat distributes evenly, temperature control is very efficient, it washes up easily and stores neatly after the handles are removed. Very pleased with this product! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Marie Blu

customer_reviews.title: Temperature control malfunctions -> griddle doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I would have given 5 stars if the product lasted at least ONE YEAR. I understand they are not going last forever, but within 6 months it started malfunction. The griddle's temperature control senses the temperature is too hot and keep turning off. The result is griddle never reaches / stays at the temperature sufficient to cook omlet / tortilla / anything practically. Very disappointed with this purchase causing loss of money in such a short period of time. To be fair, two stars for the design, size, and construction. Would love to hear from the vendor / manufacturer if they can address the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sangs

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - makes the best pancakes!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this griddle. It's the perfect size, I can now make 8 pancakes at a time plus room for some sausages too. It heats evenly and fairly quickly. Pancakes literally slide off the griddle when done, very good non-stick surface. It is large so make sure you have a big enough cabinet for storage. I highly recommend this griddle!
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lightweight Non Stick Grille to make Large Quantities of Food with Minimum Counter Space
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are in love with this griddle. We use it every chance we get. It heats up a lot more evenly than our old griddle and is very light which makes it really easy to get around the kitchen with. We've made everything from eggs to bacon and even burgers and have not been disappointed yet. It heats up very quickly and the non stick surface makes it a breeze to clean. Perfect when cooking for a crowd compared to a stovetop.
customer_reviews.author: Dolly

customer_reviews.title: Great size cooking surface
customer_reviews.text: So far l love these griddles. I picked this particular one for the size as l cook for 25 people 3 meals a day and needed as much cooking surface as I could possibly get. I had enough room for 8 pancakes per griddle. The clean up was awesome. I was worried at first because of the textured surface. But ot was quick and easy. Love these griddles (I bought 2).
customer_reviews.author: susan powell

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: I love how much space this griddle has. I can fit a ton of food on it. The heating is nice and even across the whole thing too, which I was concerned about with the size. No need to worry here. Cleans up is easy and the non stick is great. The jury is still out on the removable handles, but it is easier to fit in the sink with out them attached.a
customer_reviews.author: Meggin Chase

customer_reviews.title: Uneven heat distribution
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to replace the 20 year old one we had that was flaking on the surface. Only used either one for pancakes. This one clearly does not heat evenly toward the corners. Not even just the furthest reaches of the corners, but when putting 8 pancakes on at a time (2 rows of 4) the back left pancake just doesn't turn golden brown.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Grease tray is dangerous
customer_reviews.text: It has hot spots and the removable legs are kind of a joke. You put them on and leave them on. The do wiggle a bit but still sturdy. The grease tray is terrible, it hardly stays in and is loose, my fell out during cooking luckily I wasn't frying bacon and it was empty or I would have gotten hot grease all over my legs and feet. Can you say 911 2nd degree burns!
customer_reviews.author: J. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Look no further! Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love the pop off handle feature. Easy to remove and reapply. I store my pieces (handles and drip pan) in a 1 gallon ziplock bag. The nonstick surface is wonderful! Everything slides right off. Easy to control temp dial. Temperature appears even throughout. Great product! Presto never disappoints me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BIG
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a smaller griddle that had seen its better days. I love the size, and the fact that the feet come off. I can cook 6 grilled cheese sandwiches at a time, or most of a pack of bacon, or several pancakes. Works great, toss it in the dishwasher to clean it up, holding up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Fairly even heat, but weird non-stick surface
customer_reviews.text: This griddle heats fairly well and cleanup is easy, but the non-stick coating has a weird diamond-shaped pattern on it. The result is pancakes with a texture on the the surface, not a nice smooth pancake. It's just weird. Maybe they do that so there is less surface area touching the food and thereby making it less sticky, but I don't like it.
customer_reviews.author: Zippy

customer_reviews.title: Fast heat up and good quality
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, we make all sorts of stuff on it, pancakes, grilled cheese etc. We don’t cook meats in it. People complain that the griddle falls apart and peaks and such and it has to do with how you clean it and when you cook meats on it. No matter what you say if you cook meats on any griddle, at some point it’s going to fail you. Stick to your breads and you will be good.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett M Miller

customer_reviews.title: Unsure
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how I feel about this. It cooks fine, but it’s impossible to get it clean afterward. No amount of soap, water, or scrubbing will get the textured surface clean. It’ll look clean under the running water, but after drying it looks like I haven’t bothered to wash it. Really not sure why.
customer_reviews.author: Seoh

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my husband and HE LOVES IT! Uses it every chance he can get. This is thin enough to just stay on our counter top. The only thing I wish, that this whole plate could be detached to become dishwasher safe. I wish I wish! Then it would be perfect but for now it is still amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Genesis B.

customer_reviews.title: Great griddle.
customer_reviews.text: Great for just about all frying needs. We make sausage patties and pancakes at the same time. We also use it to make frozen fries and buggers at the same time. Just start the fries first, the the burgers. The fries come out as crispy as in the oven ( don't deep fry our fries). And, it's the best thing for making a whole pound of bacon.
customer_reviews.author: salfogliano

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for cooking for a group.
customer_reviews.text: I've really enjoyed this griddle. I use it to cook up a lot of bacon or burgers for a group. I live in an RV Park and keep it at the Clubhouse where my neighbors use this grill often and it's holding up very well to frequent use. It would be great for camping, traveling or at home cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hood

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice. Good value. No regrets.
customer_reviews.text: Best griddle I've owned. Easy to clean. Heats evenly. I'm taking off one star because mine sits a bit too level - I wish the rear feet were elevated maybe slightly so bacon grease would drain into the drip tray easily instead of just spreading out and making me have to tip it periodically. I'm going to put some self-adhesive rubber pads on the the back legs.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Rain

customer_reviews.title: Go for it,,,,get it..believe me.
customer_reviews.text: You have to get one of these. temperature is excellent, high and low sections, super fast heat, NO MESS, smooth surface, is a beauty...assembly is a breeze. I just mase french toast and let me tell you, this thing can make your dreams come true....I Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: air

customer_reviews.title: Slides Right Off
customer_reviews.text: Got to use this item day after receiving. I must say, it heated up very quickly and well, however there is a little bit of hot spots... not very drastic or deal breakers. I made some easy over eggs and warmed a tortilla... Wish it cam with a spatula .. I really dont want to scratch the diamond surface so pretty and functional. I did go out an buy one, but that aside, great item! 💜💜
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: I though I was having issues with the electrical connection, but I wasn't sure. The heating light would go on and off frequently. I thought is might be normal. After a while the light would go on occasionally and the griddle would get hot. The electrical connection is poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Regular Guy

customer_reviews.title: Grease cup is a definite safety hazard!
customer_reviews.text: I love this griddle, except for the grease cup. It is EXTREMELY dangerous when cooking bacon, or similarly fatty foods. The cup is loosely attached, and when full of grease, it can tilt and cause serious burns to the user. Presto could have designed the grease cup to be much more efficient! Very poor design.
customer_reviews.author: dhwhite

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean up. Works great for large family.
customer_reviews.text: We are a family of 6 so cooking pancakes, french toast, omlets, grilled cheese, etc. was time consuming on stove top. I had previously owned a griddle that I hated due to difficulty cleaning and very poor design. It kept me from buying another for years. Fortunately, I started looking around at better options and found this. Cleaning is easy and we use it daily. I can't really think of anything I'd change.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Where was this all my life?
customer_reviews.text: We love this griddle. Cook everything on it because so easy to clean. Took it on driving trip with another family and made full breakfast for 11 big eater. Only negative is heat distribution. Less heat on one end compared to other side. But it’s so long that we don’t care because it can fit alot in the heated area. I use the less heat area to hold cooked stuff that needs to stay warm. So EASY to clean and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: OP

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GRIDDLE AND GREAT PRICE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS GRIDDLE!!!! THE BEST PART IS THAT IT CAN GO IN THE DISHWASHER, AND THAT IT COMES APART TO FIT I MY CUPBOARD NICELY. COOKS EVENLY AND NOTHING STICKS TO IT. I WAS HESITANT TO BUY THIS AS THEY ALL SEEM THE SAME, BUT I AM SO GLAD I BOUGHT THIS. I'VE HAD IT AWHILE, BUT USE IT ALL OF THE TIME AND I DON'T SEE ANY WARPING OF ANY KIND AND IT STILL HEATS EVENLY. IT EVEN COMES WITH A PAPER THAT SAYS WHAT TEMP THINGS SHOULD COOK AT. IT'S GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Willett

customer_reviews.title: Great heat distribution
customer_reviews.text: Have only used this twice but so far very pleased. Heat distribution is great. Handles are easily removed for storage. Large surface area for cooking. Makes me look like a pancake pro. Only complaint so far is that it does take a long time to heat up. Very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: B. Beavers

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: It's not only for pancakes. I make home made corn tortillas. I'll make tortillas while I am cooking carne guisada, some refried beans, and mexican rice.etc.by the time I'm done cooking all that I have a good amount of tortillas done to go along with the meal. Saves me lots of time and its very useful! So glad I bought it. So much that I'll be buying one for my mom.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: A breakfast must
customer_reviews.text: I love having the griddle to cook multiple items at once. It is sturdy enough, easy to clean, the price is decent, and there was no damage. The only issue is that the heat does not seem evenly distributed over the entire surface, plus the little set arrow is quite hard to see.
customer_reviews.author: Wilma Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Really like the removable handles
customer_reviews.text: We keep this one in our travel trailer to use when camping. We usually set it on a table outside to cook breakfast. Camp fires are nice but who wants to build a camp fire when you first wake up? I will probably buy another one for the house. The removable handles and non-stick surface make it a breeze to clean. The collection tray is nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Sunday brunch
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for Sunday brunch. I have a lot of grand kids. When they come to visit, my son likes to make lots of pancakes. Before I purchased this griddle, we had to use every skillet that I owned to have enough cooking space for all the pancakes. As a result, there was no room to scramble eggs or cook bacon. Now with this fabulous over-sized griddle, he can make the pancakes at the table while I tend to the eggs and bacon on the stove. I think it would be a good warming plate for a big Thanksgiving meal as well. And yes, it cleans up very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mary go rita

customer_reviews.title: Works great but...
customer_reviews.text: This appliance works great for making flour tortillas and quesadillas! It did have a chip out of the back rail when I unpacked it. The packaging was the type you would buy it in at the store. Not very substantial for shipping although there was no visible damage to that packaging it was damaged when opened. Maybe it was packed that way. I don't know. Like I said it works great and is easy to clean. The chip does not hurt its performance so I'm will willing to deal with it. If given the option to add an Amazon box you may want to take it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is great!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love pancakes! I hate making pancakes because in our skillet you could only make a decent sized pancake one at a time. That is very time consuming. We have made pancakes on this and it worked great. We let it warm up before we actually start using it. I was actually able to get a double batch of pancakes done in 20 minutes, before school. This griddle is VERY non-stick. It was a challenge to actually flip them over. My fiance, made hamburgers on it and it was hard for him to flip the burgers, but everyone got to eat at the same time and no one had to wait for them to get done.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with this griddle. It does heat slightly different from one area of the griddle to the other but nothing terrible. I've cooked eggs, bacon and pancakes and they all cooked fairly evenly. For the price the quality and function is perfect for our use. And it is a cinch to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony P. Tamburri

customer_reviews.title: Great Griddle for the Family!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great griddle! It’s so easy to assemble. You pull clips to the side and can easily remove the handles, which allows for easy cleaning and storage. The grease tray is easy to remove and clean. Also, the temperature is regulated so you don’t burn your food. Over all, I’m very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Hillebrand

customer_reviews.title: If only it distributed heat well
customer_reviews.text: Great but there seems to be certain areas that the griddle doesn't cook or get as hot so the meat and things don't cook evenly. It is quite frustrating. It sure is easy to clean and store. It's slightly heavy- dont let the flatness fool you.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Liu

product_meta.title: Presto 07061 22-inch Electric Griddle With Removable Handles,Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThis extra-large griddle cooks enough food for the entire family and features detachable handles for compact storage. Simply open the latch clips to release handles from base. With handles removed, the base stores neatly in most standard 18-inch kitchen cabinets. Premium textured cooking surface provides enhanced nonstick performance for stick-free cooking and easier cleaning. Control Master* heat control automatically maintains the desired cooking temperature. Heavy cast aluminum base is virtually warp-proof. Slide-out drip tray removes and cleans easily. Griddle is fully immersible with the heat control removed. 120 volts AC, 60 Hz only, 1500 watts
feature_bullets: Premium nonstick surface provides stick-free cooking and easy cleaning. Slide-out drip tray removes and cleans easily.
Control Master heat control maintains the desired cooking temperature automatically. Heavy cast aluminum base is virtually warp-proof.
Griddle is fully immersible with the heat control removed.
Simply open latch clips to detach handles from griddle base. No tools needed.
With handles removed, base stores in most standard 18-inch kitchen cabinets.Cooking area: 231 square inch

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars7,146 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
